name: Pedro G. Romero. Máquinas de trovar
description: New project by Pedro G Romero in which the artist's unique operations are presented before, after and during his work with Archive F.X, and with which the author continues his interest in the social production of value, General Intellect. In the same line, with Israel Galván and el Niño de Elche, he has created his presentation for dOCUMENTA 14.The works included here, are not collaborative, nor do they combine cooperative wills, nor do they even appeal to any notion of us, but they deal with the construction of that which is common, since they have been carried out far from any subjective formalization. They are shown together here so we can all find out their character.

name: Jordi Lafon. Aquí no passa res
description: Exhibition by Jordi Lafon, a multidisciplinary artist who uses drawing, painting,  sculpture, installations, video or actions to narrate poetic or vital experiences. He has a special predilection for objects and tools, which he collects for years, for his memory and for the relationship they have or have had with people through work.

name: Ágora Juan Andrés Benítez, una illa al cor del Barri Xino
description:
On 5 October 2013, six Catalan police killed Juan Andrés Benítez Aurora Street, in the neighborhood of Raval. Some recorded images from a home recorded the disproportion of police intervention.
 The neighbors and social groups and promote the campaign #JusticiaJuanAndrés every 5 of every month meet at the same place of his death, to remember and to demand justice. Just in front of where they killed him there is a lot left. These same neighbors when it fulfills the 1st anniversary of his death, releasing space and give it new life. This day was founded Agora Juan Andrés Benítez, an island in the heart of Chinatown.

name: Ramon Masats. 1953-1965 Anys de joventut
description:
The exhibition gathers 61 of the dozens of photographs that the Catalan took during his beginning years and which go beyond its iconic work of the seminarians. Masats was and one of the greatest figure of Spanish photography, and belongs in an extraordinary generation of photographers who entered us in the 50’s in the modernity through their work. 
 As a self-taught photographer, he developed a work close to French documentary photography, participating in the renewal of this technique through his innovative compositions and, above all, the actualization of his realities in a direct and spontaneous way, without previous studies or retouching. In each of his photographs, the artist, or artisan as he is designated, transforms banality into singularity and provides autonomy to the small details he captures.

name: Les cares de Barcelona
description:
A new exhibition at the Ethnological Museum of Barcelona proposes that releasing the images of the city that we know that we are a fresh new look, and we project a new view of Barcelona or, rather, on many faces that hosts the Catalan capital. The exhibition will open on January 22 at 12 pm in a ceremony attended by Deputy Mayor of the City of Barcelona Jaume Collboni. 
 No, what you see in this exhibition is not a summary of the city or a summary of its main features, but an invitation to rethink the city from some elements (people, messages, parties, streets and buildings, cultures ...), which give title to the different areas of the exhibition and constitute tools to analyze new perspectives from the city where we live. 
 So, we'll try the streets of the city as a public space with a physical dimension, but also as a set of rules established by the institutions and arrangements with some public participation. What attitudes, faces, costumes and architectural landscapes characterize Barcelona? Here are some clues to discover it.
price:
General 5,00 
 Reduced 3,50€ 
 Free Check the website

name: Björk Digital
description: Björk Digital is an immersive virtual reality exhibition that presents the digital and video works produced by the collaboration of the iconic Icelandic artist and some of the world’s best programmers and visual artists.The show arrives at the CCCB after visiting Tokyo, Sydney, Montreal, Reykjavik, London and Los Angeles and is the only chance to visit the exhibition in Spain.

name: Talking Brains. Programats per parlar
description:
There are about 6,000 languages in the world but there is only one language ability, which is rooted in a brain that is unique: that of our species. 
 From the perspective of the brain, all human beings speak common language: the human. An immersive experience exposes visitors to the idea that world languages, large variety at first, come on actually a brain that is common to the human species and is determined a specific biology.

name: ACTE 37: Marc Larré. De aquellas fotos estos barros
L’Arxiu Històric de la Ciutat de Barcelona. Cent anys al servei del patrimoni, la informació, la recerca i la cultura
description:
The Archives is celebrating in 2017, its first centenary. A resolution adopted by the plenary Town Council on 21 June 1917, gave the starting signal for the creation, in order to preserve and enhance the value of documentary heritage historic city. 
 The celebration has as main objective to present the archive funds and archive his work as a centennial institution dedicated to the preservation of documentary heritage of the city and the promotion of research, knowledge, information and historical information about the city of Barcelona.

name: Silver Songs. The Music of Andy Warhol
Victoria Rabal i Javier León Pérez. Fuga y captura
Paul McCarthy. WS & CSSC, Drawings and Paintings
Els artistes de D. H. Kahnweiler
Fer mercats, fer ciutat. La xarxa de mercats de Barcelona, dibuixada
La Barcelona del 1700
description:
The archaeological work carried out within the grounds of the old Born market have made it possible to know in detail a piece of the urban fabric of Barcelona and find traces of life that developed there. 
Among the many documents preserved testaments of residents of the area and inventories related to many of the homes appeared allowed us to discover first-hand what life was like in Barcelona at the time.

name: El cinema és fantàstic. 50è aniversari del Sitges-Festival Internacional de Cinema Fantàstic de Catalunya
Santi Moix. The Brooklyn Navy Yard
description:
Galeria Carles Taché is pleased to announce the opening of The Brooklyn Navy Yard, a solo show by artist Santi Moix (Barcelona, 1960).
 The exhibition is going to be held from Thursday March 2nd until next June 2017 and it gathers the most recent works done by Moix at his studio, located in the namesake place to the title of the exhibition. 
 They are large format paintings, all of them devoted to floral representation, a topic that has caused fascination among many different artists throughout the history of art and that has also demonstrated its capacity to agglutinate the most diverse viewers.

name: Andrei Farcasanu. The Quiet Sense Of Nature
Things Only I Know About Tim / Things Only I Know Abuot Wieteke
Olaf Pla Gracia. Kushti, la Índia: sudor y arena
description: The Kushti is an ancestral art where the wrestlers are given to a combat on the sand of the Akhara, the noble place where they live and practice this fight. This is the title of this exhibition where, from a concept of classic documentary photography, and from analog film snapshots, Olaf Plan Gracia raises a debate about the Giclée copy with the series Luchadores and the traditional development with enlarger, bucket And liquids.

name: Altres artistes a la donació Picasso 1970
LV Premi Internacional de Dibuix Ynglada-Guillot 2017
Patrim'16. Patrimoni de la Facultat de Belles Arts
Animals sagrats de l'antic Egipte
description: Through the objects from the collection of Museu Egipci de Barcelona, we can discover lots of aspects of the relationship that the ancients Egyptians established with the animal universe in their immediate environment. In addition of their use as economic resources, pets or hunting preys, animals appear in many cultural manifestations of the Pharaonic Egypt. Therefore, there are a lot of hieroglyphics that depict animals; while others were reproduced in objects used by cosmetic products or in pieces of furniture; and others became characters, as human beings, of satirical compositions.

name: Helena Pérez Garcia. Al otro lado
Re_visions. 10 anys de vídeo a Barcelona Producció
Oleguer Junyent, col·leccionista. Roda el món i torna al Born
Imatges per creure. Catòlics i protestants a Europa i Barcelona, segles XVI-XVIII
Elena López Lanzarote. Dibujos porque sí
El disseny com a espai de debat, hibridació i transformació
Templers. Guerra i religió a l'Europa de les Croades
Un mundo ideal. El supermercado del antropoceno
El disseny com a espai de debat, hibridació i transformació
David Bowie Is
description: The exhibition David Bowie is will take place at Museu del Disseny de Barcelona (Barcelona Design Museum) starting May 25, 2017. The show, produced by the Victoria and Albert Museum in London, has already been seen by a 1.5 million visitors during its world tour to cities including Berlin, Paris and Chicago. One of the most successful exhibitions in the long-standing history of the Victoria and Albert Museum (V&A) finally comes to Barcelona
price:
Tickets standard weekend (Frid-Sund) 17.90 €
Tickets weekdays (Mon-Thur): 14.90 €
Tickets Fast Pass (Any day at any time): 24.90 €

name: Ketty La Rocca. Le mie parole
description: Ketty La Rocca (La Spezia, 1938 – Florence, 1976) may have had only a brief career yet her work remains a paradigmatic example of the way some of the more striking experimental practices of the 60s and 70s were pursued in Europe. A pioneer in the field of visual poetry and a member of the legendary Gruppo 70, she produced pieces that explore performance, collage and video art. This exhibition is the first solo show to bring together her entire oeuvre in Spain.

name: La fi és el principi. Pràctiques funeràries a la Catalunya Prehistòrica
Navegants d'aiguamolls. 2000 anys de secrets enfonsats
Ismael Smith, la bellesa i els monstres
Dalí, Breaking News
description: ‘Dalí, Breaking News’ underscores the artist’s innate ability to make himself the focus of attention in the media, his international presence, the passions he aroused and his relationships with well-known personalities. In addition to the images, the exhibition features a screening of the interview with the artists on the A fondo programme on TVE, the Spanish public television channel, which was broadcast on 27 November 1977. The information and quotes from Salvador Dalí featured in the exhibition were taken from this interview.

name: Enemic de gàbies. Joaquim Molas i les avantguardes
Mediapro Live. La revolució en directe
description: The exhibition lets visitors look back over some of the most iconic images of the last 20 years, take part in a script meeting using 360º technology with the team from the TV show El Intermedio, and view the beating heart of the MEDIAPRO Group through 100 touchscreen tablets featuring the work and the figures of the biggest audiovisual group in Europe. The exhibition presents the 50 people whose work or vision of the world have influenced the Group’s history, and reveals the creativity and effort that lie behind the hundreds of projects that MEDIAPRO has instituted in the last 24 years, many of which have been distinguished with top-level awards.

name: Oleguer Junyent, fotògraf. Roda el món i torna al Born
Weegee by Weegee
description: In the New York convulsion of the 30s and 40s, Weegee was a freelance graphic reporter who published in all the major newspapers and who turned crime into spectacle. Always alert, he carried in his car a radio tuned to the frequency of the police that allowed him to arrive the first to the scene of the crime. His technique, with hard backlights, gave the photos an aura of verismo and drama that continues to impact the viewer.
price:
General 4€, concessions 3€* 
Free entrance: Colectania's Friends and Benefactors, students from our partner schools (IDEP, IEFC, GrisArt), unemployed. First Sunday of each month.

name: A la vora de la mar. Instruments musicals de la Mediterrània
Gustavo Díaz Sosa. Si alguno tiene ojos, que vea!
Anna Malagrida. Cristal House
description: The winner of the Carte Blanche PMU award presents her most recent project at galeria SENDA, after being exhibited at Centre Pompidou

name: David Ostrowski. Bei mir geht es in den Keller hoch
Jaume Pitarch. La pràctica impossibilitat del dejuni
Jose Dávila. Every Blind Wondering Ends in a Circle
Alberto Gil Cásedas. 72,969 kg. Enciclopèdia de pes de l'artista
Els pilars d'Europa. L'edat mitjana al British Museum
Krea. Mirades diferents en processos creatius
TPK. Art i Pensament Contemporani. Solstici 2017
3Dcòmic
description:
This exhibition of sculpture and photography is the result of a process of learning and exploration of an artist and a photographer in the world of three dimensions.
Give volume to comics artist Jordi Pérez has always became a challenge that could hardly be achieved through conventional sculpture.

name: De la casa als carrers. Mapa social de l'Eixample durant la Transició
Miguel Ángel Cardenal. Las macetas de mi madre
Brian Eno. Lightforms / Soundforms
description:
Lightforms / Soundforms is, to date, the world's most comprehensive exhibition dedicated to the work of Brian Eno as an artist.
For the occasion, the artist has created the piece New Space Music, a musical installation specifically conceived for his visit and to be listened to in the Max Cahner Cloister in Arts Santa Mònica.

name: Mar Martín. A. L. M. A.
Éluard, Cramer, Miró - «À toute épreuve», més que un llibre
The Way Things Do
description:
The exhibition is a tribute to The Way Things Go, the iconic film by Peter Fischli and David Weiss, celebrating its 30th anniversary. The show includes three installations by upcoming artists and a screening of the film by the Swiss artist pair. 
 In The Way Things Do, Serafín Álvarez, Cécile B. Evans and Daniel Jacoby & Yu Araki offer three reinterpretations of the legendary chain reaction of objects while exploring the notions of circuits and traces, the role of objects in relation to audiences or the nature of interactions between data, machines and artificial intelligence. Althought the three resulting pieces are independent from each other, they are all based on the film by Fischli and Weiss, while also stemming from shared, collaborative production processes.
price:
General admission Joan Miró collection + temporary exhibition €12 
Concessions*: €7
Only Temporary exhibition 7€

name: Cloe Masotta. D’un píxel un poema
Lucía C. Pino. Torrent Echidna, Attractor
